Do you swaddle him? Same thing happened to us when we first came home. We couldn’t swaddle him well, and he would always get a hand out and get angry. Since then, we have started using Velcro swaddles. I swaddle him, rock him, and let him get into a deep sleep (about 10-15 minutes after he initially falls asleep), then transfer him. We also use a sound machine. That’s the only way I can get him to sleep in his bassinet. He is 3 weeks old for reference ☺️

I gave up with my daughter after 2 weeks of sleepless nights trying to put her to sleep in her bassinet. She was waking up every 30mins. I bought a large bed guard and was putting her down to sleep right next to me ( not in between me and my husband) this worked well for us. At least like this she was sleeping for at least 2 hrs straight. Not all babies are the same. With my first born We had no problems at all he use to sleep through the night in his own crib however with my 2nd it was completly differant. ( bed guard I had was similar to the one in tje pic)

Our 5 week old also goes to sleep on me after a feed. I keep her sideways and place her in the bassinet (sometimes still have to gently swaddle her) and keep 2 hands on her until she settles for a couple of minutes. 1 hand along her spine and the other on her head. After a few minutes I gently roll her on her back and then still keep 1 hands on her head until I think she settles.
Sometimes she still wakes up and I give her a cuddle over my shoulder for 5 mins and then back into the bassinet on her back and hand on her head again. Doesn’t always work but it is normally enough. She sleeps for about 2 hrs.
It took a lot of trial and error to find something that works. Hopefully you find something soon xx
Also when I first started I was also changing before the feed. Now at night I feed and then change her and then feed again

Mine had the same problem when she was 2 weeks.
Due to gassiness, she would not sleep on her back and we had to put her on us. Slowly I tried the side lying feed and sleep position. That worked and I still couldn’t move.. if I did she’d wake up immediately.

Now at 6 weeks, she’s able to sleep on her own. Infact she started sleeping by herself at 5 weeks.

I’d say give them the warmth and comfort they need. Soon they’ll feel comfortable to sleep on their own. Atleast mine did.
Good luck mama, don’t stress.. they are this little and will need you only for so long. So soak it in while you can ❤️

You are six days too late to teach your baby the desired habit. Babies are like puppies. Once you train them to do something it’s going to be difficult to train them to do something else. It takes patience. Make a list of the behaviour you desire and teach that consistently from the very beginning. For now all you can do is to stop cosleeping completely and put baby in the bassinet. Baby wakes up, pick him up soothe and back to the bassinet. It is going to be tough and will take days but baby will forget cosleeping. I don’t cosleep with my baby at all. I do 1 hour of kangaroo mother every day. Baby sleeps in the bassinet at night and on her day bed during the day. I don’t allow baby to sleep in anyone’s arms right from the day she was born. She is 1 month old now. Your baby is a clean slate. She will learn only what you teach her. So if you r disciplined and consistent baby will be too 😘 hope this helps.

My apologies that my comment is rubbing mothers the wrong way. It was my intention only to help and be precise and clear. I thought being a mother would be instinctive and everything would fall into place but it didn’t. I needed help and advice and these are the things I was told that really helped me. Every mother is different and every baby is different too. But repetition is habit forming in all babies alike. Some take longer and some learn quickly. As a mother you choose what is acceptable to you and what is not. For eg I won’t cosleep with my baby at night no matter what because I also think it is dangerous ( fyi I coslept with my puppy until the day my baby arrived🤷‍♀️) but I will never let my baby cry and self soothe to sleep. I find it horrifying and an unacceptable practise. But it is widely accepted and desired practise by so many mothers. So to each their own.

Also I never said babies are puppies. But even if I did, I would still not understand the horror it has caused here. I have a puppy and a baby and do I think they are the same. Of course not. But I did teach my puppy the same way I am going to teach my baby right now. Basic things like sleeping, eating, potty is the same across species. It does not take intelligence. Just needs to be taught over and over until it becomes a habit. I hope this makes sense and doesn’t still offend. If it still offends you please chalk it up to the cultural difference between you and I.

[NAME REDACTED] there are a lot of parameters to consider. For eg- do you exclusively breastfeed? If you do, baby is in your arms a lot and gets the comfort she desires and so will be willing to sleep independently but if she is bottle fed maybe cosleeping is the comfort giving element she doesn’t want to give up. Are you a working mother or stay at home like me? I spend every waking and sleeping hour with my daughter. The only time I leave her is to go to the bathroom and bath time. So she may be willing to sleep by herself and not in my bed. But if I were to be away a lot she might cling to me and want to sleep stuck to me. Like this there are a lot of parameters to consider before coming to a set of rules that work for you and your baby.

Look up the safe 7- guidelines to co-sleeping. Turns out that SIDS increases under certain conditions (parents smoke, are on specific medications, etc.) so it's not the same risk for all people to co-sleep.
We exclusively breastfeed. During the day she sleeps fine in her bassinet but at night she has to be touching me to sleep. Otherwise she’s up all night.
As long as you follow safe sleep 7 it’s safe for baby to be in bed with you. Eventually when they’re older they can sleep on their own. I wouldn’t stress to much about it

My daughter was 3 weeks old the first time I put her in my bed. I rolled over and she was asleep in the bassinet and she was blue. She has silent reflux and had an episode while I was asleep, I guess my mom instincts woke me up. When we got home (we went to my moms for 3 weeks for moral support) I had a bassinet with high sides made to go in our bed. So I did that in between my and my wife and she slept perfectly fine in there, because I kept my hand on her until she went to sleep. If she started stirring I could put my hand back on her. When she got to big for that, well for my comfort at least, I moved her to a regular bassinet on the side of my bed. She had gotten used to being in a bassinet. She knew if she needed me, I would be there. She is now in her crib beside my bed.

I transfer her using a blanket. I put a blanket completely under her and wrap her up like a little taco. So top open. I hold her till she is good and asleep and I use my hand under her head so it doesn’t flop, and to stabilize her and pick her up with the blanket so she still feels secure, like she’s getting a hug and I ever so slowly let her down in her crib. I put her whole body down but not completely, until she gets used to the cold then I completely lay her down and completely straighten out her blanket. Which happens to be her lovey, she won’t sleep without it, anyways and under her completely flat is the safest way for her to have it. She’s 3 months now.

So this happened with my son too. In The hospital and for the first like 4 days PP he was fine in the bassinet and then after that he’d only go in there for MAYBE 45 mins before waking. Needles to say I was sooooo tired and frustrated. I cried a few times bc honestly I was so tired it was making me nuts. I started letting him sleep in the bed with me, on me, but it freaked me out bc I was so scared he would roll off and get hurt or worse. So, at five weeks in, we made and change that seems to be working. At 7 weeks now, he is still sleeping swaddled and on his back in the crib in his room. It was a hard call to make, but it’s working. He wakes up now about 2 times a night depending on bedtime. We’re still trying to work out when it’s best to get him down, but between 9pm and 11pm is the norm. Last night he went down at 9pm. He STAYED ASLEEP until 1 am and then it took me and hour to get him back to sleep at 2 am but he stayed out until almost 5:40 am. KEEP TRYING things. What works for others might not work for your family. We like HAVE to change the diaper, swaddle him, feed him, all while in the dark playing the white noise. He sleeps with the noise machine on the whole time.

My little girl was exactly the same so I sleep with her next to me. My health advisor actually recommended it. I keep the next to me cot up so if she was to roll near the edge she would roll into her cot. But she doesn’t because my weight sinks the mattress, so she naturally leans towards me. Take away all cushions & don’t have duvets near them. My little girl has been so much more settled since and can actually get some sleep. Have a read about safe co sleep online or speak to your HV, made such a difference for us. Now that she has got more settled into a sleep routine she is more confident in going in her own cot.
